metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13143 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick before 6.9.7-6 and 7.x before 7.0.4-6, the ReadMATImage function in coders/mat.c uses uninitialized data, which might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0100-Use-of-uninitialized-data-in-ImageMagick-coders-mat..patch in unstable 0086-Use-of-uninitialized-data-in-ImageMagick-coders-mat..patch in stretch 0296-CVE-2017-13143-Fix-use-of-uninitialized-data-in-ReadMATImage.patch in wheezy 0268-CVE-2017-13143.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11').
